summary: This document is an email chain from August 28, 2019, regarding the release of the final medical examiner's report on Jeffrey Epstein's death to law enforcement. An FBI/NYPD Task Force member requests the report be provided to a specific NYPD detective who works with the FBI's Violent Crimes Task Force.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the medical examiner's report regarding his death on August 10, 2019.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died; the medical examiner's office prepared a final report on his death.

events.title: Request for ME Report Release
events.description: An FBI/NYPD Task Force member emails the Office of the Chief Medical Examiner to request the final report on Epstein's death be released to a specific NYPD detective.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain dated August 28, 2019, concerning the release of the final medical examiner's report on Jeffrey Epstein's death.
The request is made by a member of the FBI/NYPD Violent Crimes Task Force to the Deputy Director of Forensic Investigations at the NYC Office of the Chief Medical Examiner (OCME).
The requester asks that the report be released to a specific NYPD detective who is also assigned to work with the FBI's Violent Crimes Task Force.
The email indicates the OCME was prepared to release the report to the FBI, and the task force member is coordinating the handoff to the involved detective.
The document highlights inter-agency cooperation (FBI/NYPD/OCME) in the investigation following Epstein's death.
